title: Do’s

metadata.author: Nina Evason
metadata.note: All research and editorial content is developed and curated by Mosaica.

description: Recommended behaviours that support respectful and harmonious social interactions in Malaysian cultural contexts.

guidelines.text: Smile when meeting people, as Malaysians value warmth and friendliness in social interactions.
Maintain harmony in conversations and address problems indirectly and graciously when they arise.
Offer sincere compliments when appropriate, as this helps give others ‘face’ and shows respect.
Be open to discussing personal background and show genuine interest in family, as this is appreciated.
Wear modest clothing by covering shoulders and ensuring skirts or shorts extend past the knees.
Show respect and maintain appropriate distance when interacting with people of the opposite gender, particularly among Malays.
Recognise and respect social hierarchy by deferring to elders or those of higher status and using appropriate honorifics.
Compliment hospitality, as it is considered a reflection of character and highly valued, especially among Malays.
